Ax8bMMXceZzT1J9e.name: Alcohol (1 serving)
Ax8bMMXceZzT1J9e.descriptionvalue:
Price 0.5-50 mkk; Weight 0.2 lb.;

Every culture of Roshar has its own intoxicating traditions, such as beers, mudbeers, ciders, honu, shiki, juices, and lagers.

In Vorin society, almost all forms of alcohol are referred to as “wine” regardless of their ingredients. Such wines are known by their distinct colors, which are infused into each beverage so they can be distinguished at a glance. From least intoxicating to most, the types of wine are:

Color

Effect

Pink

Noted as being floral and aiding alertness.

Less intoxicating than milk

Orange

A non-intoxicating wine that tastes of fruit with notes of ginger. Most popular with members of the clergy.

Yellow

Offers a bold and deep flavor “without guilt.”

Minimally intoxicating

Auburn

Spicy with an earthy aroma. Brewed with fermented fruit.

Red

Flavorful wine with a pleasant burn.

Sapphire

Nutty with notes of honey, made with fermented lavis grain

Blue

Carries complex notes of berry and lemon.

Violet

Potent liquor with an aroma of spiced sandalwood.

Considered the most flavorful of the wines

EtOTdo7HEPUYg1l4.name: Alcohol (bottle)
EtOTdo7HEPUYg1l4.descriptionvalue:
Price 1-300 mkk; Weight 2-4 lb.;

Every culture of Roshar has its own intoxicating traditions, such as beers, mudbeers, ciders, honu, shiki, juices, and lagers.

In Vorin society, almost all forms of alcohol are referred to as “wine” regardless of their ingredients. Such wines are known by their distinct colors, which are infused into each beverage so they can be distinguished at a glance. From least intoxicating to most, the types of wine are:

Color

Effect

Pink

Noted as being floral and aiding alertness.

Less intoxicating than milk

Orange

A non-intoxicating wine that tastes of fruit with notes of ginger. Most popular with members of the clergy.

Yellow

Offers a bold and deep flavor “without guilt.”

Minimally intoxicating

Auburn

Spicy with an earthy aroma. Brewed with fermented fruit.

Red

Flavorful wine with a pleasant burn.

Sapphire

Nutty with notes of honey, made with fermented lavis grain

Blue

Carries complex notes of berry and lemon.

Violet

Potent liquor with an aroma of spiced sandalwood.

Considered the most flavorful of the wines

Wl0TlHmr1byqb9Ls.name: Anesthetic (5 doses)
Wl0TlHmr1byqb9Ls.descriptionvalue:
Price 75 mk; Weight 1.5 lb.;

Usually made from fathom bark or winterwort, you can apply a dose of anesthetic ointment to an injury after a short or long rest to reduce its recovery time by [[/r 1d4]] days. Each injury can be treated with anesthetic only once per day.

t0oc6ADwgqQMHI8A.name: Antiseptic (potent, 5 doses)
t0oc6ADwgqQMHI8A.descriptionvalue:
Price 50 mk; Weight 1 lb.;

Knobweed milk, fourleaf sap, and lister’s oil can all be used to make a strong antiseptic. A dose can be applied to a character after a short rest to restore [[/r 2d6]] health.

hWD3H4XLoyjwkwnd.name: Antiseptic (weak, 5 doses)
hWD3H4XLoyjwkwnd.descriptionvalue:
Price 25 mk; Weight 1 lb.;

A dose of weak antiseptic, such as that made from larmic mucus, can be applied to a character after a short rest to restore [[/r 1d6]] health.

C4o8jIXuVulD9qS9.name: Axe
C4o8jIXuVulD9qS9.descriptionvalue:
Damage 1d6 keen; Range Melee; Traits Thrown [20/60]; Expert Traits Offhand;

Type Heavy Weapon; Weapons Skill Heavy; Price 20 mk; Weight 2 lb.;

g7wp6B76l6FPLCpj.name: Backpack
g7wp6B76l6FPLCpj.descriptionvalue:
Price 8 mk; Weight 5 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

5cvMonV3oiBFhuJd.name: Barrel
5cvMonV3oiBFhuJd.descriptionvalue:
Price 15 mk; Weight 70 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

Y190QA0BpnAtdfl9.name: Blanket
Y190QA0BpnAtdfl9.descriptionvalue:
Price 2 mk; Weight 2 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

aEWkmpwm8ADHz2Q1.name: Book (reference)
aEWkmpwm8ADHz2Q1.descriptionvalue:
Price 10–500 mk; Weight 1–5 lb.;

Each reference book contains information on a particular topic, such as a historical era, engineering, biology, architecture, or crafting a particular type of fabrial. When you have time to reference a book while making a related test using your Intellect attribute, you’re considered to have an expertise in the topic (see “Expertise Benefits” in chapter 3).

MoUFXEtYNV2x9PLz.name: Bottle (crem)
MoUFXEtYNV2x9PLz.descriptionvalue:
Price 0.5 mk; Weight 3 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

eag6Tzp50qP6ZSbR.name: Bottle (glass)
eag6Tzp50qP6ZSbR.descriptionvalue:
Price 1 mk; Weight 2 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

xLer8raOT6EkLfWN.name: Breastplate
xLer8raOT6EkLfWN.descriptionvalue:
Deflect Value 2; Traits Cumbersome [3]; Expert Traits Presentable;

Price 120 mk; Weight 30 lb.;

xAbLSkWTFIfF5mjX.name: Bucket
xAbLSkWTFIfF5mjX.descriptionvalue:
Price 1 mk; Weight 2 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

XWnG7IsaVfRIULF2.name: Candle
XWnG7IsaVfRIULF2.descriptionvalue:
Price 0.2 mk; Weight 0.2 lb.;

While lit, the candle sheds light in a 15-foot radius. It burns for up to 6 hours before becoming unusable.

UQVUFD1E6xHxMXTL.name: Case (leather)
UQVUFD1E6xHxMXTL.descriptionvalue:
Price 4 mk; Weight 1 lb.;

A sealable, cylindrical case that can store up to ten pages of paper or parchment and protect them from the weather.

Bystka90e7cqadwo.name: Chain (thick, 10 feet)
Bystka90e7cqadwo.descriptionvalue:
Price 20 mk; Weight 10 lb.;

This sturdy chain can be used in securing cargo, shackling prisoners, and other situations where strength is essential. This chain can be broken by succeeding on a DC 30 Athletics test or by dealing 15 damage to it

9LsAo2FryXTcHnnZ.name: Chain (thin, 1 foot)
9LsAo2FryXTcHnnZ.descriptionvalue:
Price 20 mk; Weight 0.5 lb.;

This thin chain is often used in jewelry and Soulcasters, usually made of precious metals in fine links. This chain can be broken by succeeding on a DC 20 Athletics test or by dealing 5 damage to it.

6y5hONLMQa4O2wnU.name: Chain
6y5hONLMQa4O2wnU.descriptionvalue:
Deflect Value 2; Traits Cumbersome [3]; Expert Traits Loses Cumbersome;

Price 80 mk; Weight 25 lb.;

cYClVA9bvZYDUw1K.name: Chest
cYClVA9bvZYDUw1K.descriptionvalue:
Price 30 mk; Weight 25 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

SZLmzHRi3n9zqpO8.name: Clothing (common)
SZLmzHRi3n9zqpO8.descriptionvalue:
Price 2 mk; Weight 3 lb.;

Plain clothes are made of affordable materials and are generally undyed, helping you fit in among the commonfolk. While wearing these clothes, you gain an advantage on spiritual tests made to convince others you’re from the lower class.

9Z2IGrA7MAorXfB1.name: Clothing (fine)
9Z2IGrA7MAorXfB1.descriptionvalue:
Price 50–200 mk; Weight 6 lb.;

Fine clothes are made of silks or other high-quality materials, colored using expensive dyes, and often stitched with fine embroidery. Wearing fine clothes helps you to blend into high society, such as noble banquets, without arousing suspicion. While wearing these clothes, you gain an advantage on spiritual tests made to convince others you’re from the upper class.

moMefd103M5JGLNx.name: Clothing (ragged)
moMefd103M5JGLNx.descriptionvalue:
Price 0.5 mk; Weight 1.5 lb.;

This clothing may have once been of fine or common make, but it’s now barely holding together. While wearing these clothes, you gain an advantage on spiritual tests made to convince others you’re destitute

TtqfZFRd4bAEfEuU.name: Crowbar
TtqfZFRd4bAEfEuU.descriptionvalue:
Price 10 mk; Weight 3 lb.;

You can use a crowbar to gain an advantage on Athletics tests where the crowbar’s leverage can be applied.

ktvj23zgmpAHneXy.name: Ear Trumpet
ktvj23zgmpAHneXy.descriptionvalue:
Price 50 mk; Weight 1 lb.;

Distant sounds heard through an ear trumpet can be perceived as though at half the distance. At the GM’s discretion, more powerful ear trumpets may be available at higher prices.

Z6aQuxMZaTZTBwRv.name: Flask
Z6aQuxMZaTZTBwRv.descriptionvalue:
Price 1 mk; Weight 1 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

nqOz2mX8i5WVjuaa.name: Flint and Steel
nqOz2mX8i5WVjuaa.descriptionvalue:
Price 4 mk; Weight 1.5 lb.;

A flint and steel can be used as 1 to light abundant fuel within reach. Starting a fire under more challenging circumstances can take 1 minute or more. Herdazians often wear a tool called a sparkflicker as jewelry or other ornamentation; they can use this like flint and steel by quickly running their crystalline fingernails along it.

wxqRzS3bkSu9P6Us.name: Food (fine, 1 day)
wxqRzS3bkSu9P6Us.descriptionvalue:
Price 25 mk; Weight 0.5 lb.;

Fine food can be found in high-class restaurants and on the tables of nobles’ feasts.

ETmexaHpuN26SKOf.name: Food (ration, 1 day)
ETmexaHpuN26SKOf.descriptionvalue:
Price 0.2 mk; Weight 0.5 lb.;

Rations are foods created for extended travel, such as jerky and hard-baked lavis cakes. They generally lack flavor, but if kept dry, they remain edible indefinitely.

36QMlnmzORM20vyU.name: Food (street, 1 day)
36QMlnmzORM20vyU.descriptionvalue:
Price 3 mk; Weight 1.5 lb.;

Every culture of Roshar has its own street confections, ranging from loaves of bread to more specific cultural foods like Herdazian chouta.

2rSLME2ExPqGVhOD.name: Grappling Hook
2rSLME2ExPqGVhOD.descriptionvalue:
Price 10 mk; Weight 4 lb.;

A grappling hook is typically attached to the end of a rope to aid in scaling or descending from walls and cliffs. A securely anchored grappling hook grants an advantage on Athletics tests made to climb using its attached rope.

You can use an @UUID[Compendium.cosmere-rpg.actions.Item.iqjFbO4BLuTSt4cQ]{Interact} action to attach the grappling hook to an anchor within reach without making a test. Alternatively, you can throw and attach it to a suitable anchor within 20 feet of you by succeeding on an Athletics or Agility test (DC set by the GM).

GlrRu1goky9ifKCl.name: Half Plate
GlrRu1goky9ifKCl.descriptionvalue:
Deflect Value 3; Traits Cumbersome [4]; Expert Traits Cumbersome [3] instead of [4];

Price 400 mk; Weight 40 lb.;

iqUiycqvN1RT7zsb.name: Hammer (handheld)
iqUiycqvN1RT7zsb.descriptionvalue:
Price 4 mk; Weight 3 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

OBPoBfwLrZg0Unz6.name: Hammer
OBPoBfwLrZg0Unz6.descriptionvalue:
Damage 1d10 impact; Range Melee; Traits Two-Handed; Expert Traits Momentum;

Type Heavy Weapon; Weapons Skill Heavy; Price 40 mk; Weight 8 lb.;

sV3aKGbE4z2hIp7A.name: Improvised Weapon (Heavy)
sV3aKGbE4z2hIp7A.descriptionvalue:
Damage 1d — ; Range —; Traits Fragile; Expert Traits Unique;

Type Special Weapon; Weapons Skill Heavy; Price —; Weight —;

Edit this Improvised Weapon statblock to match the most fitting weapon from the Heavy Weapons table

In the heat of the moment, you might wish to attack with an object that isn’t a traditional weapon (such as hitting someone with a pot) or use a weapon in an unconventional way (such as swinging a shortbow at someone like a staff). If you can pick an object up in one or both hands, you can use it as an improvised weapon!

Expertise. Unlike other entries on the Special Weapons table, you can choose Improvised Weapons as a weapon expertise. If you do, your improvised weapon attacks benefit from the expert traits of the weapon most similar to it, even if you don’t have expertise in that similar weapon.

Using an Improvised Weapon. When you attack with an improvised weapon, the GM decides which non-special light or heavy weapon it is most similar to. Make the attack as though with that weapon, but add the Fragile trait (see “Weapon Traits”)

F11gb7uLyp1HYo3u.name: Improvised Weapon (Light)
F11gb7uLyp1HYo3u.descriptionvalue:
Damage 1d — ; Range —; Traits Fragile; Expert Traits Unique;

Type Special Weapon; Weapons Skill —; Price —; Weight —;

Edit this Improvised Weapon statblock to match the most fitting weapon from the Light Weapons table

In the heat of the moment, you might wish to attack with an object that isn’t a traditional weapon (such as hitting someone with a pot) or use a weapon in an unconventional way (such as swinging a shortbow at someone like a staff). If you can pick an object up in one or both hands, you can use it as an improvised weapon!

Expertise. Unlike other entries on the Special Weapons table, you can choose Improvised Weapons as a weapon expertise. If you do, your improvised weapon attacks benefit from the expert traits of the weapon most similar to it, even if you don’t have expertise in that similar weapon.

Using an Improvised Weapon. When you attack with an improvised weapon, the GM decides which non-special light or heavy weapon it is most similar to. Make the attack as though with that weapon, but add the Fragile trait (see “Weapon Traits”)

C5JbKlzjhMb5BCt1.name: Ink (1-ounce bottle)
C5JbKlzjhMb5BCt1.descriptionvalue:
Price 40 mk; Weight 0.2 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

L9rfws3QW6esZa2n.name: Ink Pen
L9rfws3QW6esZa2n.descriptionvalue:
Price 0.1 mk; Weight 0.1 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

8jiTAUlkwCBPPBn7.name: Jug
8jiTAUlkwCBPPBn7.descriptionvalue:
Price 2 mk; Weight 4 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

k0aKCdFJU0m2lZbv.name: Knife
k0aKCdFJU0m2lZbv.descriptionvalue: Damage 1d4 keen; Range Melee; Traits Discreet; Expert Traits Offhand, Thrown [20/60];

pz0fnW7XPXuFVzfj.name: Ladder (10-foot)
pz0fnW7XPXuFVzfj.descriptionvalue:
Price 5 mk; Weight 20 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

8278hojFUEdJ8asc.name: Lantern (oil)
8278hojFUEdJ8asc.descriptionvalue:
Price 20 mk; Weight 2 lb.;

While lit, this lantern sheds light in a 30-foot radius. It burns for up to 6 hours per pint of oil.

bsY2Vk9cqqol50Mi.name: Lantern (sphere)
bsY2Vk9cqqol50Mi.descriptionvalue:
Price 20 mk; Weight 2 lb.;

This lantern includes a locked cage, usually just under 1 foot in diameter, into which infused spheres can be placed to shed light. Depending on how full the lantern is, it sheds a different radius of light: 60 feet when entirely filled with spheres, 30 feet when half full, 15 feet when quarter-filled, and 5 feet when at least 1 mark or broam is within it. The lock can be opened with its included key or a successful DC 15 Thievery test

fcLjn9zc7Q0N1LK1.name: Lock and Key
fcLjn9zc7Q0N1LK1.descriptionvalue:
Price 50 mk; Weight 1 lb.;

This sturdy lock can be opened with its included key or a successful DC 20 Thievery test. At the GM’s discretion, locks that require higher DCs may be available at higher prices.

AP0Relfu1xrRSW5A.name: Lockpick
AP0Relfu1xrRSW5A.descriptionvalue:
Price 5 mk; Weight 0.5 lb.;

You can use a lockpick to gain an advantage on Thievery tests made to pick a lock. After this test is resolved, the GM can spend c to cause the lockpick to break.

ex4dg2bXFpC5HTv6.name: Longspear
ex4dg2bXFpC5HTv6.descriptionvalue:
Damage 1d8 keen; Range Melee [+5]; Traits Two-Handed; Expert Traits Defensive;

Type Heavy Weapon; Weapons Skill Heavy; Price 15 mk; Weight 9 lb.;

yzR4gLjOV6njxdde.name: Longsword
yzR4gLjOV6njxdde.descriptionvalue:
Damage 1d8 keen; Range Melee; Traits Quickdraw, Two-Handed; Expert Traits Unique: loses Two-Handed trait;

Type Heavy Weapon; Weapons Skill Heavy; Price 60 mk; Weight 3 lb.;

5sH5poLPx75U008u.name: Mace
5sH5poLPx75U008u.descriptionvalue:
Damage 1d6 impact; Range Melee; Traits —; Expert Traits Momentum;

Type Light Weapon; Weapons Skill Light; Price 20 mk; Weight 3 lb.;

sfOmwcZkWFsAH3vj.name: Magnifying Lens
sfOmwcZkWFsAH3vj.descriptionvalue:
Price 400 mk; Weight 0.2 lb.;

You can use a magnifying lens to gain an advantage on skill tests made to appraise or inspect a small or highly detailed item.

1B2y1GOYjXkFPnDv.name: Manacles
1B2y1GOYjXkFPnDv.descriptionvalue:
Price 10 mk; Weight 6 lb.;

These metal restraints, which come with a key, can bind the wrists or ankles of a Large or smaller character. They can be escaped with a successful DC 25 Agility test, broken by succeeding on a DC 25 Athletics test or by dealing 15 damage to them, or lockpicked by succeeding on a DC 20 Thievery test. At the GM’s discretion, manacles that require higher DCs may be available at higher prices.

1D7DMIDmAkD2qSsE.name: Mirror (handheld)
1D7DMIDmAkD2qSsE.descriptionvalue:
Price 25 mk; Weight 2 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

2ch99zKHQAmMDDvT.name: Musical Instrument
2ch99zKHQAmMDDvT.descriptionvalue:
Price 1–50 mk; Weight 0.5–20 lb.;

Every culture of Roshar has its preferred instruments and musical stylings. Instruments are often used for enjoyment, passing time, or busking for chips. When playing an instrument, you can determine the quality of your performance by making a skill test using a related skill (such as Agility for a stringed instrument, Athletics for drums, or Discipline for an instrument with many keys). If you have an expertise in that instrument, you gain an advantage on the test.

AHdOOVbbGn8iAijr.name: Net (fishing)
AHdOOVbbGn8iAijr.descriptionvalue:
Price 10 mk; Weight 15 lb.;

This net of fine mesh is used to ensnare fish. You can use this net to gain an advantage on physical tests related to fishing.

OqScvHsaAx9OQC70.name: Net (hunting)
OqScvHsaAx9OQC70.descriptionvalue:
Price 4 mk; Weight 5 lb.;

This net of thick rope can ensnare animals or enemies. While holding this net, you can use 1 to make an Athletics test against the Physical defense of a Large or smaller character within 15 feet of you. On a hit, the character is Restrained and knocked Prone. That character or another within reach can use the @UUID[Compendium.cosmere-rpg.actions.Item.iqjFbO4BLuTSt4cQ]{Interact} action to make a DC 15 Athletics test, freeing the trapped character on a success. If a character is Restrained by multiple nets, they must be freed from each separately.

bi2zCzju2StdcD8W.name: Oil (1 flask)
bi2zCzju2StdcD8W.descriptionvalue:
Price 1 mk; Weight 1 lb.;

Oil generally comes in a 1-pint flask made of dried crem. Oil is flammable and can be used to fuel oil lanterns, to create dangerous terrain in a space, or as an improvised weapon (sling). When you hit or graze a target with this improvised weapon, you coat the target in oil in addition to the normal damage. Following the attack, regardless of the result, the crem flask breaks and any unused oil is lost.

lJPHqUMvQu8WGTv7.name: Paper or Parchment (1 sheet)
lJPHqUMvQu8WGTv7.descriptionvalue:
Price 0.5 mk; Weight 0.1 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

cwL7YLMZGYcS0q65.name: Perfume (1 vial)
cwL7YLMZGYcS0q65.descriptionvalue:
Price 20 mk; Weight 0.5 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

f84CZl47SNkOqv4A.name: Pick (mining)
f84CZl47SNkOqv4A.descriptionvalue:
Price 10 mk; Weight 10 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

OiallgGGlDszCskh.name: Pitcher
OiallgGGlDszCskh.descriptionvalue:
Price 2 mk; Weight 4 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

PUl6WUqoodh5qRu0.name: Poison (effectual, 1 dose)
PUl6WUqoodh5qRu0.descriptionvalue:
Price 50 mk; Weight 0.2 lb.;

Often manufactured using Roshar’s deadly blackbane plant, poison comes in single-dose glass vials. As 1 , you can pour it into food, liquid, or a container, or you can apply the poison to a melee weapon or a piece of ammunition you’re holding. When you do, the GM may require you to make a Stealth test to avoid discovery. When a character ingests the poison or is hit by an attack using the poisoned weapon or ammunition, the poison is expended, and the character suffers the following effects:

Effectual Poison. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Athletics test or take 2d8 vital damage and be Stunned for 1 hour.

lLknxxWUF0BDDr28.name: Poison (potent, 1 dose)
lLknxxWUF0BDDr28.descriptionvalue:
Price 120 mk; Weight 0.2 lb.;

Often manufactured using Roshar’s deadly blackbane plant, poison comes in single-dose glass vials. As 1 , you can pour it into food, liquid, or a container, or you can apply the poison to a melee weapon or a piece of ammunition you’re holding. When you do, the GM may require you to make a Stealth test to avoid discovery. When a character ingests the poison or is hit by an attack using the poisoned weapon or ammunition, the poison is expended, and the character suffers the following effects:

Potent Poison. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Athletics test or take 3d10 vital damage and be Stunned for 1 hour. While Stunned in this way, the target is Immobilized.

jlZoxCcsuNTxwJUo.name: Poison (weak, 1 dose)
jlZoxCcsuNTxwJUo.descriptionvalue:
Price 20 mk; Weight 0.2 lb.;

Often manufactured using Roshar’s deadly blackbane plant, poison comes in single-dose glass vials. As 1 , you can pour it into food, liquid, or a container, or you can apply the poison to a melee weapon or a piece of ammunition you’re holding. When you do, the GM may require you to make a Stealth test to avoid discovery. When a character ingests the poison or is hit by an attack using the poisoned weapon or ammunition, the poison is expended, and the character suffers the following effects:

Weak Poison. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Athletics test or take 1d6 vital damage.

t2JCxvssYjeBRKKt.name: Pot (iron)
t2JCxvssYjeBRKKt.descriptionvalue:
Price 8 mk; Weight 10 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

4IQumMw1alca7Y6y.name: Pouch
4IQumMw1alca7Y6y.descriptionvalue:
Price 1 mk; Weight 1 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

srbUHbEivIaTpdDR.name: Pulley system
srbUHbEivIaTpdDR.descriptionvalue:
Price 100 mk; Weight 12 lb.;

Most commonly used by engineers and artifabrians, this system includes four pulley wheels, 30 feet of rope, and a hook. When you have time to set up a pulley apparatus before lifting an object, you treat the object as being a quarter of its normal weight.

Ey4SP9Ne3xFD2FQx.name: Rope (50 feet)
Ey4SP9Ne3xFD2FQx.descriptionvalue:
Price 30 mk; Weight 5 lb.;

Rope is usually made of seasilk (or less commonly, lavis grain or rockbud fibers) and sold in 50-foot lengths that can be cut and tied to change its length as needed. It can be cut by dealing 2 damage to it, or it can be ripped apart with a successful DC 20 Athletics test.

h1uaED8PVGyJTQlh.name: Sack
h1uaED8PVGyJTQlh.descriptionvalue:
Price 0.2 mk; Weight 0.5 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

3cSUoevOKoTJLsi0.name: Scale
3cSUoevOKoTJLsi0.descriptionvalue:
Price 20 mk; Weight 3 lb.;

Most commonly used by scholars, ardents, appraisers, and gem cutters, a scale can accurately determine the weight of an object (to a maximum of 2 pounds)

fV3Adif5imyAc5m5.name: Shield
fV3Adif5imyAc5m5.descriptionvalue:
Damage 1d4 impact; Range Melee; Traits Defensive; Expert Traits Offhand;

Type Heavy Weapon; Weapons Skill Heavy; Price 10 mk; Weight 2 lb.;

VuNjyCtkobEQKdOx.name: Shortbow
VuNjyCtkobEQKdOx.descriptionvalue:
Damage 1d6 keen; Range Ranged [80/320]; Traits Two-Handed; Expert Traits Quickdraw;

Type Light Weapon; Weapons Skill Light; Price 80 mk; Weight 2 lb.;

5CvSwkwuSRArPTM2.name: Shortspear
5CvSwkwuSRArPTM2.descriptionvalue:
Damage 1d8 keen; Range Melee; Traits Two-handed; Expert Traits Unique: loses Two-Handed trait;

Type Light Weapon; Weapons Skill Light; Price 10 mk; Weight 3 lb.;

TKC0YHl2jsjTHLII.name: Shovel
TKC0YHl2jsjTHLII.descriptionvalue:
Price 8 mk; Weight 5 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

0mE1SpjOuNtgR0eq.name: Sidesword
0mE1SpjOuNtgR0eq.descriptionvalue:
Damage 1d6 keen; Range Melee; Traits Quickdraw; Expert Traits Offhand;

Type Light Weapon; Weapons Skill Light; Price 40 mk; Weight 2 lb.;

sIQUnzsOsgmJB5Rp.name: Soap
sIQUnzsOsgmJB5Rp.descriptionvalue:
Price 1 mk; Weight 0.1 lb.;

This item is included for narrative purposes and does not have any specific statistics or rules.

ttOzXRJ7yp1OVmnB.name: Spyglass
ttOzXRJ7yp1OVmnB.descriptionvalue:
Price 500 mk; Weight 1 lb.;

Distant objects viewed through a spyglass can be perceived as though at half the distance. At the GM’s discretion, spyglasses that allow distant objects to appear even closer may be available at higher prices.

zyDACVYDa0N9N31r.name: Staff
zyDACVYDa0N9N31r.descriptionvalue:
Damage 1d6 impact; Range Melee; Traits Discreet, Two-Handed; Expert Traits Defensive;

Type Light Weapon; Weapons Skill Light; Price 1 mk; Weight 4 lb.;

iTRQRGVW3ikGLsZa.name: Surgical Supplies
iTRQRGVW3ikGLsZa.descriptionvalue:
Price 20 mk; Weight 3 lb.;

This satchel contains enough bandages, salves, splints, and other medical supplies to be used 10 times. When you make a Medicine test to treat a wounded character (or to similarly use these medical supplies), you can expend one of these uses to gain an advantage on the test.

QIZPolZmEpdZTBtf.name: Treatment (medical, 1 dose)
QIZPolZmEpdZTBtf.descriptionvalue:
Price 10 mk; Weight 0.2 lb.;

Rosharan surgeons treat ailments with a variety of treatments, generally made from bitterleaf or bloodivy. During a short rest, you can use a dose of such a treatment to cure a character of one of the following conditions, given that its source isn’t a permanent injury: Disoriented, Exhausted (reduces the penalty by 1), or Stunned.

8vqNzFDXNaJ0N9He.name: Tuning Fork
8vqNzFDXNaJ0N9He.descriptionvalue:
Price 50 mk; Weight 0.5 lb;

A tuning fork can transfer Stormlight from one sphere or gemstone to another. While using a tuning fork, you can use spheres to recharge fabrials, @UUID[Compendium.cosmere-rpg.items.Item.NDRl7pSNVLR2mqYj]{Shardplate}, and @UUID[Compendium.cosmere-rpg.items.Item.72GKzVSmaHCrqymp]{half-shards} as if the spheres were unencased gemstones.

pmCJVW855Q3Kj6dW.name: Unencased Gem (infused)
pmCJVW855Q3Kj6dW.descriptionvalue:
Price 2 mk; Weight 0.01 lb;

Unlike spheres with gemstones encased in glass, unencased gems leak Stormlight quickly, going dun within several days depending on their cut. This permeability allows unencased gems to recharge fabrials and @UUID[Compendium.cosmere-rpg.items.Item.NDRl7pSNVLR2mqYj]{Shardplate}. Radiants can also breathe in Stormlight from unencased gems as if they were spheres, gaining the same benefit.
